processGroups.name: Incremental Load
processGroups.comments: Reads data from the source database's CDC stream, and performs incremental replication for enabled tables.

processGroups.name: Create Journal Table
processGroups.comments: Converts the source table schema to the journal table schema and creates in Snowflake both journal schema and table corresponding to given DDL FlowFile.

processors.name: Create Schema If Not Exists
processors.comments: Creates the schema for the journal table.

processors.name: Mark Replication as Failed
processors.comments: Change the replication state of the table to permanently failed, requiring manual intervention.

processors.name: Convert To Journal Schema
processors.comments: Converts the source table schema to the journal table schema.

source.name: Convert To Journal Schema
source.comments: Converts the source table schema to the journal table schema.

destination.comments: Creates the schema for the journal table.

processors.name: Wait for Snapshot Load to Finish
processors.comments: Waits until the Snapshot load for a table is complete, and the connector can start merging incremental changes.

processors.name: Drop First DDL
processors.comments: Drops the first DDL FlowFile to prevent it from deleting a freshly-created journal table.

processors.name: Read PostgreSQL CDC Stream
processors.comments: Read CDC events from the PostgreSQL stream for tables added to replication. Ignore changes from other tables.

processors.name: Merge Rows Into Bigger FlowFiles
processors.comments: Collect incoming rows into bigger FlowFiles to process them more efficiently later.

processors.name: Mark Replication as Failed
processors.comments: Change the replication state of the table to permanently failed, requiring manual intervention.

processors.name: Process Schema Changes
processors.comments: Handles DDL events from the CDC stream, checking whether the journal and destination table need to be updated.

processors.name: Merge Journal to Destination
processors.comments: Merges all pending changes from the journal table into the destination.

processors.name: Alter Destination Table
processors.comments: Changes the destination table based on the incoming DDL event.

processors.name: Set Source Table FQN
processors.comments: Add an extra attribute to the FlowFile with the source table's Fully Qualified Name.

processors.name: Schedule Warehouse
processors.comments: Group all FlowFiles related to same table to limitate merge calls. Use this processor to schedule with cron when warehouse should be active.

processors.name: Mark Replication as Failed
processors.comments: Change the replication state of the table to permanently failed, requiring manual intervention.

processors.name: Remove Rows from FlowFile
processors.comments: Removes source rows from FlowFiles after they were uploaded to Snowflake. Keeps attributes for use later in the flow.

processGroups.name: Stream Staleness Prevention
processGroups.comments: Prevents streams on Journal tables to become stale when data is not actively pushed within the data retention period. See https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/streams-intro#data-retention-period-and-staleness

properties.SQL Query: SHOW STREAMS like '%journal%' IN DATABASE #{Destination Database}

processors.name: Check If Journal Streams Are Present

destination.name: Check If Journal Streams Are Present

source.name: Check If Journal Streams Are Present

processGroups.name: Snapshot Load
processGroups.comments: Starts or stops the replication of tables, and performs the initial snapshot load of data from newly added tables.

processGroups.name: Perform Snapshot Load
processGroups.comments: Runs the actual snapshot load for every newly-added table.

processors.name: Check if All Rows Stored
processors.comments: Verifies that all FlowFiles with source table rows were processed and replicated.

processors.name: Create Snowflake Table if Not Exists
processors.comments: Creates the destination table in Snowflake.

processors.name: Check if Configured to Skip Snapshot
Wait for Incremental Load to Begin
processors.comments: Waits until the replication state of the table indicates that the connector started collecting incremental changes for it. This ensures consistent replication of all changes to the source data made while the snapshot load is running.

processors.name: Create Snowflake Schema If Not Exists
processors.comments: Creates the schema for the source table in Snowflake.

processors.name: Check if Configured to Skip Snapshot

properties./columns:
arrayOf( /columns[*],
  unescapeJson('{"name": "_SNOWFLAKE_INSERTED_AT", "type": "TIMESTAMP_NTZ", "nullable": false }'),
  unescapeJson('{"name": "_SNOWFLAKE_UPDATED_AT", "type": "TIMESTAMP_NTZ", "nullable": false }'),
  unescapeJson('{"name": "_SNOWFLAKE_DELETED", "type": "BOOLEAN", "nullable": true }')
)

processors.name: Create Snowflake Table

processors.comments: Retrieves the initial snapshot of data from the source table.

processors.name: Mark Table Replication Failed
processors.comments: Updates the table's state to "permanently failed" due to an unrecoverable error encountered by the connector.

processors.name: Log Snapshot Complete Message
processors.comments: Puts an entry in the logs indicating the completion of the snapshot load.

properties.Log Message: Completed snapshot of ${source.schema.name}.${source.table.name} consisting of ${start.row.index:plus( ${rows.fetched} )} rows in ${now():minus( ${lineageStartDate} ):divide(1000)} seconds

controllerServices.name: Table Column Filter
controllerServices.comments: Keeps a list of table column filters, to include or exclude certain columns from replication.

controllerServices.name: JSON Writer
controllerServices.comments: Used to serialize database rows into FlowFiles.

controllerServices.name: Source Table Schema Registry
controllerServices.comments: Keeps a register of the latest source table schemas to compare against incoming DDL events from the CDC stream.

controllerServices.name: JSON Reader
controllerServices.comments: Used to deserialize database rows from FlowFiles.

controllerServices.name: Table State Store
controllerServices.comments: Keeps a list of tables under replication, and the stage of replication they're in.

parameters.name: Object Identifier Resolution
parameters.description: Do not change after initial start of the connector. Determines if schema / table / column names are treated as case-sensitive or case-insensitive. One of: CASE_INSENSITIVE / CASE_SENSITIVE

parameters.name: Included Table Regex
parameters.description: A Regular Expression that can be matched against table names to determine if the table should be included. The Regular Expression should match the fully qualified table name. For example, to include all tables in the "snowflake" schema, use snowflake\..*

parameters.name: Merge Task Schedule CRON
parameters.description:
CRON expression defining periods when merge operations from Journal to Destination Table will be triggered. Set it to * * * * * ? if you want to have continuous merge or time schedule to limitate warehouse run time.
For example:
 The string * 0 * * * ? indicates that you want to schedule merges at full hour for one minute
 The string * 20 14 ? * MON-FRI indicates that you want to schedule merges at 2:20 PM every Monday through Friday.
For additional information and examples, see the cron triggers tutorial in the Quartz Documentation https://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.2.2/tutorials/tutorial-lesson-06.html

parameters.name: Ingestion Type
parameters.description: Determine if snapshot load should be skipped and only incremental CDC phase should take place. If set to "incremental" current database rows will not be replicated (snapshot will be skipped) and only new changes will be applied. Default value is "full" which means both snapshot and incremental will be performed.

parameters.name: Included Table Names
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fully-qualified table names that should be replicated. The format should be <schema name>.<table name>. For example: public.table1, public.table2, public.table3

parameters.name: Column Filter JSON
parameters.description: A JSON specifying which columns and column patterns should be included or excluded from replication, per table. Takes the form of an array with one object per table, e.g. [ {"schema":"public", "table":"table1", "includedPattern":".*name"} ] - this will include all columns that end with 'name' in the 'table1' from the 'public' schema

parameters.name: Replication Slot Name
parameters.description: OPTIONAL. If the replication slot exists, the connector will start using it. If it doesn't, the connector will create a new slot with the provided name. Changing the value for a running connector will restart reading the CDC stream from the updated slot's position.

parameters.name: Publication Name
parameters.description: The name of the publication created in PostgreSQL database

parameters.name: PostgreSQL Username
parameters.description: The username for interacting with PostgreSQL

parameters.name: PostgreSQL JDBC Driver
parameters.description: The JDBC Driver JAR File reference. Download the jar from its website, then select the 'Reference asset' checkbox to upload and attach it.

parameters.name: PostgreSQL Connection URL
parameters.description: The JDBC Connection URL

parameters.name: PostgreSQL Password
parameters.description: The password for interacting with PostgreSQL

parameters.name: Snowflake Connection Strategy
parameters.description: When using KEY_PAIR, specify the strategy for connecting to Snowflake. Possible values: STANDARD, PRIVATE_CONNECTIVITY

parameters.name: Snowflake Authentication Strategy
parameters.description: When using SPCS, use SNOWFLAKE_SESSION_TOKEN as the value for Authentication Strategy. When using BYOC, use KEY_PAIR as the value for Authentication Strategy.

parameters.name: Snowflake Private Key Password
parameters.description: Leave this blank when using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy. When using KEY_PAIR, provide the password associated with the Snowflake Private Key File.

parameters.name: Snowflake Warehouse
parameters.description: Snowflake warehouse used to run queries

parameters.name: Destination Database
parameters.description: The database where data will be persisted. It must already exist in Snowflake

parameters.name: Snowflake Username
parameters.description: Leave this blank when using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy. When using KEY_PAIR, provide the user name used to connect to Snowflake instance.

parameters.name: Snowflake Private Key
parameters.description: Leave this blank when using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy. When using KEY_PAIR, provide the RSA private key used for authentication. The RSA key must be formatted according to PKCS8 standards and have standard PEM headers and footers. Note that either Snowflake Private Key File or Snowflake Private Key must be defined.

parameters.name: Snowflake Role
parameters.description: When using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy, use your Runtime Role. You can find your Runtime Role in the Openflow UI, by going to View Details for your Runtime. When using Key Pair for your Authentication Strategy, use a valid role configured for your service user.

parameters.name: Snowflake Account Identifier
parameters.description: Leave this blank when using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy. When using KEY_PAIR, provide your Snowflake account name formatted as [organization-name]-[account-name] where data will be persisted.
